page.title: 09VILLAGE HALL WELBURY&DEIGHTO
page.content: The hall in Welbury was erected in 1945 and is basically a structure made of tin sheeting.This year after great deliberation it was decided to purchase the land upon which the hall stands, and to this end an energetic round of fund raising activities has taken place ranging from a sponsered fun run to an ambitious barbeque on a cold and windy September evening. Deighton has a small hall built in 1952 and made of wood.Both halls are used once each month by the Women's Institute group, and also for Domino and Whist drives.The games are played on a progressive basis, supper is served midway in the proceedings, prizes are won, and local news exchanged. Teas, sales, elections, & meetings make up the rest of the use of the halls.
